broadwick.statistics.distributions

Class MultinomialDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.statistics.distributions.MultinomialDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class MultinomialDistribution
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Defines the Multinomial distribution with parameters numSamples and probabilities1, ...,probabilitiesd. The probability mass function is
    P[X = (x1,..., xd)] = numSamples!∏i=1dprobabilitiesixi/(∏i=1dxi!),

    where ∑i=1dxi = numSamples and ∑i=1dprobabilitiesi = 1.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      MultinomialDistribution(int n, double[] p)
      Creates a MultinomialDist object with parameters numSamples and (probabilities1,...,probabilitiesd) such that ∑i=1dprobabilitiesi = 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultinomialDistribution

        public MultinomialDistribution(int n,
                       double[] p)
        Creates a MultinomialDist object with parameters numSamples and (probabilities1,...,probabilitiesd) such that ∑i=1dprobabilitiesi = 1. We have probabilitiesi = probabilities[i-1].
        Parameters:
        n - the number of samples.
        p - the array of probabilities

    • Method Detail

        public final int getN()
        Returns the parameter N of this object.
        Returns:

      • prob

        public final double prob(int[] x)
        Returns the probability mass function p(x1, x2,…, xd), which should be a real number in [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        x - value at which the mass function must be evaluated
        Returns:
        the mass function evaluated at x
